thread.title: NBA All-Star Game 2017: Steph Curry gives Anthony Davis chance to thrill home fans
thread.title_full: NBA All-Star Game 2017: Steph Curry gives Anthony Davis chance to thrill home fans

author: Tom Gatto (tgatto@sportingnews.com)
title: NBA All-Star Game 2017: Steph Curry gives Anthony Davis chance to thrill home fans
text:
52pm  52pm EST Curry gave the hometown fans something to cheer early when he gave the ball to Davis. Stephen Curry (Getty Images) 
Updated at 8:52  52 p.m. ET 
Stephen Curry did something quite classy to begin the 2017 NBA All-Star Game on Sunday. 
Curry let hometown star Anthony Davis run the show on the game's opening possession after the Western Conference controlled the opening tip. DavisÂ took care of the rest. 
The Pelicans forward, who was a point guard in his younger days, dribbled into the frontcourt and then, working off a Curry ball screen, hit a jumper from the top of the key. NOLA host #AnthonyDavis sinks the first bucket of the 2017 #NBAAllStar ! pic.twitter.com/9ak4t5RjXg â NBA on TNT (@NBAonTNT) February 20, 2017 
A nice for way for a game in New Orleans to begin. Watch This
